Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cycloviolacin Y1 (natural AMPs; cyclotides; plants; XXC, 3S=S, UCBB1ab; ZZHp)

Literature Information.Literature: It inhibited HIV-1 infection in cultured human T-lymphoblast (CEM-SS) cells (EC50 1.21 uM) and cytotoxicity (TC50 >3.5 uM), therapeutic index (4)(Ireland et al., 2008). Cycloviolacins Y4 and Y5 are more hydrophobic (>50%) than cycloviolacin Y1 (33%), thereby more hemolytic.The same sequence has also been discovered from a different plant (Craik et al., 1999). Merged with the replaced entry AP01048. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Wang CK, Colgrave ML, Gustafson KR, Ireland DC, Goransson U, Craik DJ2008
Literature Information.Title: Anti-HIV cyclotides from the Chinese medicinal herb Viola yedoensis.
